top_reviews.title: For the low price of 1lakh, it's a worthy upgrade over it's predecessor
top_reviews.body: The media could not be loaded. CAUTION: These all tests are done in like 8-9 degrees C in Purnea Bihar In January 2024. Subject to change in normal conditions.  Like: 1) Thermal design is excellent when the fans do work. 2) Battery Life is 4 hours on youtube playback test which is excellent for an HX CPU. 3) Finally the standoff the SSDs are removable so you install any SSD in both the slots. 4) Keyboard stays cold even during gameplay. 5) Screen looks good, I compared it with a 100% sRGB screen on another laptop. 6) Surprisingly sturdy and there is a definite heft to it. It feels more well build than the last year's LOQ, though still not a Legion as this is a good plastic, but still plastic. 7) SSD is actually giving gen 4 speed unlike last gen and the Wifi card is also Intel. ...  Attaching benchmark images.  Under Review/Cons: 1) Fans don't ramp up immediately. Maybe fixed with fan profile. This causes a thermal throttle like immediately but once the fans do ramp up, they do come down in temperature and by a lot. 2) 14700HX not staying above 100W on a constant load so Cinebench R23 Multi Scores don't cross 22000 where it should have hit the 27000. 3) Default thermal paste out of the box aren't as good. It's not the PTM god knows what number in it, so I applied the Arctic MX-6. 4) Budget class Speaker, don't expect much. ...  PENDING: 1) There was a small sticker of Lenovo on the thermal module, I destroyed it to see what Lenovo technician says when they do visit. 2) Is my unit actually thermal throttling or is it just the CPU like that. 3) Did Lenovo know that the CPU isn't capable of sustaining more than 100W and so only gave the 230W charger? 4) I am new to overclocking, the CPU and the GPU both can be overclocked but I don't see thermal headroom on the CPU side to make it.... Well I don't know about it, I am trying but I can only score lower not higher, on a happier note, the temps on a cinebench score of 17000 is very low, like 55 degrees.Read more
top_reviews.body_html:
The media could not be loaded.
 CAUTION: These all tests are done in like 8-9 degrees C in Purnea Bihar In January 2024. Subject to change in normal conditions.

Like:
1) Thermal design is excellent when the fans do work.
2) Battery Life is 4 hours on youtube playback test which is excellent for an HX CPU.
3) Finally the standoff the SSDs are removable so you install any SSD in both the slots.
4) Keyboard stays cold even during gameplay.
5) Screen looks good, I compared it with a 100% sRGB screen on another laptop.
6) Surprisingly sturdy and there is a definite heft to it. It feels more well build than the last year's LOQ, though still not a Legion as this is a good plastic, but still plastic.
7) SSD is actually giving gen 4 speed unlike last gen and the Wifi card is also Intel.
...

Attaching benchmark images.

Under Review/Cons:
1) Fans don't ramp up immediately. Maybe fixed with fan profile. This causes a thermal throttle like immediately but once the fans do ramp up, they do come down in temperature and by a lot.
2) 14700HX not staying above 100W on a constant load so Cinebench R23 Multi Scores don't cross 22000 where it should have hit the 27000.
3) Default thermal paste out of the box aren't as good. It's not the PTM god knows what number in it, so I applied the Arctic MX-6.
4) Budget class Speaker, don't expect much.
...

PENDING:
1) There was a small sticker of Lenovo on the thermal module, I destroyed it to see what Lenovo technician says when they do visit.
2) Is my unit actually thermal throttling or is it just the CPU like that.
3) Did Lenovo know that the CPU isn't capable of sustaining more than 100W and so only gave the 230W charger?
4) I am new to overclocking, the CPU and the GPU both can be overclocked but I don't see thermal headroom on the CPU side to make it.... Well I don't know about it, I am trying but I can only score lower not higher, on a happier note, the temps on a cinebench score of 17000 is very low, like 55 degrees.
Read more
